intro: Aspidogyne stenocentron, commonly known as the narrow-centered aspidogyne, is a member of the Rubiaceae family. It is a small, shrub-like plant native to tropical regions of Africa. The plant features opposite, elliptic leaves with a smooth surface and a distinct midrib. Its small, white flowers are clustered in umbels, and it produces small, spherical berries as fruit. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
